meanings.sent1: She was able to effectuate positive change in her community through hard work.
meanings.sent2: The new policy will effectuate better communication among team members.
meanings.sent3: With determination and effort, they effectuated a successful fundraising event.
meanings.sent4: His leadership skills effectuated a transformation in the company's culture.
meanings.sent5: The artist's vision effectuated a breathtaking masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To put into effect or operation
meanings.sent1: The manager will effectuate the new safety protocols starting next week.
meanings.sent2: The IT team needs to effectuate the software update to improve system performance.
meanings.sent3: The magician effectuated a spell that made the audience gasp in amazement.
meanings.sent4: The conductor effectuated a harmonious symphony from the orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The chef effectuated a delicious dish that delighted all the diners.
